title: Active template synthesis
content:
Chem. Soc. Rev., 2024, 53,10216-10252
DOI: 10.1039/D4CS00430B, Review Article
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Romain Jamagne, Martin J. Power, Zhi-Hui Zhang, Germán Zango, Benjamin Gibber, David A. Leigh
The active template synthesis of rotaxanes, catenanes and knots exploits the dual ability of metals, or particular arrangements of functional groups, to serve as both a template and a catalyst to assemble and covalently capture interlocked molecules.
